commitResults.messageTitle: Bug report / Team response: Replace placeholder text with a hint (#716)
commitResults.messageBody:
When a user opens a new bug report / new team response,
the response form gets filled in with some placeholder text.

Users sometimes wish to submit their bug report / team response
without a written response. In these cases, they have to manually
delete the placeholder text, before submitting the form.

Let's replace the placeholder text with a hint, to make
the user experience smoother.

commitResults.messageTitle: Issue model: Remove unnecessary ternary operators (#715)
commitResults.messageBody:
Let's improve readability by removing the
ternary operator from some long / confusing statements
in the Issue class.

commitResults.messageTitle: LoggingService: Improve tests by minimising implementation details (#725)
commitResults.messageBody:
A lot of implementation details are used in the logging service tests.
This makes it difficult to maintain the tests, because we have to
spend additional effort ensuring the test code's correctness.
In addition, it is difficult to refactor the logging service,
as refactoring will also require changes to the test code.

Let's redesign the tests such that they only use methods that
are can be considered part of the logging service's public API.

commitResults.messageTitle: Web version auth: redirect to GitHub, instead of using pop-up (#729)
commitResults.messageBody:
The web version of CATcher opens a pop-up window to visit
the GitHub login page.

This hampers the user experience slightly as users
have to enable pop-ups for CATcher, before using it.
In addition, we have to maintain code for managing the pop-up
window.

Let's make CATcher redirect to the GitHub login page
within the same window, instead of using a pop-up.
This will make our code simpler, while eliminating
conflicts arising from browser settings or pop-up blockers.

HTML tags are rendered as-is in the text editor preview.

For better security, let's ignore HTML tags in the user input.
We can selectively allow some HTML tags in future.

commitResults.messageTitle: Make Download Log Button Appear Before Login (#730)
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, download logs are only available after
the user has logged in.

Let's make the download logs button available before
the user has logged in, so that we may attain
information about errors before authentication.

commitResults.messageTitle: LoggingService: Move "download as file" logic, into separate module (#745)
commitResults.messageBody:
The extractLogFile() method of LoggingService contains code that
handles creating and downloading the log file. This code is not
strongly related to logging.

Let's move this file-downloading logic into a separate
module to simplify and increase the modularity of LoggingService.

commitResults.messageTitle: LabelService: Create only the needed labels (#738)
commitResults.messageBody:
When synchronising the repository in the user's account for Bug Reporting
and Tester Response phases, CATcher automatically create labels that are
unnecessary and unused. (e.g. status.* and responses.* labels).
These labels are used in the team response phase.

Within LabelService, let's separate the labels required for different
phases so that only the relevant labels are created in the repository
 of the corresponding phase.

Certain labels (e.g type.Feature_Flaw) are ambiguous to the user.

The user might not fully understand what the scope of the label is and needs 
the label reference from the CS2103T website to grasp its meaning. This 
becomes troublesome for the user as they are unable to easily access the label 
definitions. 

Let's make use of the Angular Dialogue Material to display more information 
about the label if the user chooses the read more about the label within the 
app itself.

commitResults.messageTitle: AuthComponent: Log the selected settings repo (#720)
commitResults.messageBody:
For easier troubleshooting, let's log the name of the settings repo
selected by the user.

As the `assertSessionDataIntegrity` operator already performs
validation of the session data, there is no need to validate the
current phase again in the PhaseService#storeSessionData method.

Let's remove the additional check in PhaseService#storeSessionData.

commitResults.messageTitle: Increase number of labels in a single fetch (#728)
commitResults.messageBody:
We do not specify the number of labels to fetch when using the GitHub,
API; hence it fetches a default number of 30 labels in a single fetch.

Fetching the maximum number of labels allowed by the API will allow
us to fetch all labels in most repos and reduce chances of bugs
that occur when all labels are not fetched.

Let's set the number of labels to be retrieved in a single
fetch to be 100 (the maximum possible)

Methods used to parse data.csv file have vague return types such as
{}. Readers have to delve into the details of each method to understand
the structure of the returned value.

Let's
- Define data types for the different kinds of parsed data
- Specify the returned data type for the different data parsing methods

This will help developers understand the kind of data being parsed
and returned for each method under data.service.

encodedText field represents the repository name for CATcher profiles 
e.g. `CATcher-org/public_data`.  This name does not give developers 
an accurate idea of the data the variable holds,

Let's change the naming of `encodedText` to `repoName`.

commitResults.messageTitle: Tester Response Phase: Display changes to issue severity and type (#727)
commitResults.messageBody:
During tester response phase, disputed issues only show their
original severity and type.

Tester has to click on the issue and enter the view issue section,
to read the description and discover the dispute details.

Let's display the severity and issue type chosen by the
responding team on the issue table (if any).

We can obtain this information by parsing the comments on the
tester response phase repo's issues (in TesterResponseSection class).

loginIds are casted to lowercase before being stored as keys in an 
javascript object to represent the teams structure after it is parsed 
by data.service.

The dropdown list under assignees is dependent on these keys to obtain 
the list of possible assignees, making it displayed in lowercase.

Let's obtain the list of possible assignees by using the original casing of
loginId in User.

This will allow us to display the assignee names under the dropdown 
list in its original casing.

Let's also add test cases to ensure the user is created regardless of 
letter case.
